intro: Vicia bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá vetch, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, temperate climates. The plant features trifoliate leaves and produces small, pea-like flowers in shades of purple or pink. Its root system is fibrous and adapted to nutrient-poor soils. Vicia bogotensis is often found in grasslands and along stream banks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
